intro: Ewartia planchonii var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded everardia, is a flowering plant species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. This variety is distinguished by its leathery, smooth seeds, which set it apart from other varieties within the Ewartia genus.
